Gisborne photographer wins category in international pet photography competition https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-photographer-wins-category-in-international-pet-photography-competition/YMYPB7MYBND5NGWDW24V6HBS7M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-photographer-wins-category-in-international-pet-photography-competition/YMYPB7MYBND5NGWDW24V6HBS7M/ 'It was truly surprising and an incredible honour' Thu, 28 Nov 2024 23:29:24 +0000 Gisborne farmer and photographer Rebecca Williams' shot of dogs on her and husband Guy's Matawai farm which won the documentary section of an international pet photography competition that attracted 3621 entries from 41 countries.

South Island officer bought firearms under fake names, misused police systems, IPCA finds https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/south-island-officer-bought-firearms-under-fake-names-misused-police-systems-ipca-finds/YVLLAUCLXRA4JH6HK2ZSZJUSMU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/south-island-officer-bought-firearms-under-fake-names-misused-police-systems-ipca-finds/YVLLAUCLXRA4JH6HK2ZSZJUSMU/ Ben TomsettThe IPCA says public interest favoured prosecution in this case. Thu, 28 Nov 2024 23:18:56 +0000 A firearms industry spokesman said the incident showed how New Zealand’s firearms registry was vulnerable to misuse. Photo / Supplied
